text: Hello <@UTRK2UKEY> not sure if you have seen this already but PieSync by HubSpot has a <https://www.piesync.com/HubSpot/unleashed/|HubSpot/Unleashed connector> that may give you what you need!
Hi Rahmona, thanks for your message. Yes we did explore that, but turns out that PieSync doesn't work with the deals object.
as in, it won't sync the deals object with Unleashed

Ah Ok so you need to sync with Deals. This is something that the PieSync team is working on but I don't have a timeline as too when this will happen.

The <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> channel is a great place to connect with HubSpot developers if you need to build a custom integration in the interim.

Also I noticed some solutions like <http://cloudpipes.com|cloudpipes.com> who look like they may sync deals.

Thanks <@UFBDBKQ1H>. I'll post a message in the jobs channel.
I also spoke with another HubSpot agency earlier today and it sounded promising. We might be able to do something custom.

All, looking for some help with Form Submission API.

We have used this form submission API on one of the forms from our HubSpot portal. We did all the testing and took it live last night. But now this form is not collecting/recording any new data. And it says this error below,

"Contacts are limited to 1,000 form submissions. As the contact has reached this limit, their submission wonâ€™t show up on their contact record and they won't be enrolled in workflows based on this form."
We have already deleted the test contact records from Contact Database. but still shows this error.,

Thank for the response Neal)
Unfortunately `profile` scope  does not allow call to *`/crm/v3/owners/`*
There must be some another API endpoint for this scope.

Here is response form the HubSpot API server
```status: 'error',
message: "This app hasn't been granted all required scopes to make this call. Read more about required scopes here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/scopes>.",
correlationId: 'b75771f1-4950-4b12-92f5-3d250f05dcc3',
errors: [Array],
links: [Object],
category: 'MISSING_SCOPES' ```
